Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Replace bitonic sort with radix sort in GPU BWT and add parallel rank assignment

The GPU BWT was 14-640x slower than CPU due to bitonic sort''s O\(log²n\)
kernel launches per doubling step. This replaces it with LSB-first 8-bit
radix sort \(8 passes per step\) and moves rank assignment from sequential
CPU readback to parallel GPU prefix sum \(Blelloch scan + scatter\).

Key changes:
- New kernels: bwt_radix.cl \(compute_keys, histogram, scatter\) and
  bwt_rank.cl \(compare, prefix_sum, propagate, rank_scatter\)
- Fix critical bug: enqueue_read_buffer offset is in bytes, not elements
- Remove dead bitonic sort code \(kernel compilation + method\)
- GPU BWT tests use round-trip verification \(GPU circular prefix-doubling
  produces valid but not byte-identical output vs CPU SA-IS for periodic inputs\)
- Add FSE benchmark to stages.rs, expand all benchmarks with large sizes
  and timeout caps

GPU BWT throughput improved ~1.8x at 64KB \(56ms → 31ms\) but remains
slower than CPU — future work needs fused kernels or a different algorithm.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
